backend

Class UserMapper

  • java.lang.Object
    • backend.UserMapper

  • public class UserMapper
extends java.lang.Object
    UserMapper is used for updating and getting data from the Customer and FogUser table in the MySQL database.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      UserMapper(java.sql.Connection conn)
      Constructor that sets the private attribute Connection to the Connection parameter.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void insertUser(User customer, java.lang.String password)
      Inserts a User object's data into Customer table in the MySQL database.
      User validateAdmin(java.lang.String email, java.lang.String pass)
      Returns a User object based on the two String parameters email and pass.
      User validateCustomer(java.lang.String email, java.lang.String pass)
      Returns a User object based on the two String parameters email and pass.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • UserMapper

        public UserMapper(java.sql.Connection conn)
        Constructor that sets the private attribute Connection to the Connection parameter.
        Parameters:
        conn - SQL Connection to set.

    • Method Detail

      • validateCustomer

        public User validateCustomer(java.lang.String email,
                             java.lang.String pass)
        Returns a User object based on the two String parameters email and pass. User object can be null. Should be used when validating a customer.
        Parameters:
        email - String value of the email.
        pass - String value of the password.
        Returns:
        User object. Will return NULL if the email or password are not equal to the ones in the Customer table.

      • validateAdmin

        public User validateAdmin(java.lang.String email,
                          java.lang.String pass)
        Returns a User object based on the two String parameters email and pass. User object can be null. Should be used when validating a FogUser/admin.
        Parameters:
        email - String value of the email.
        pass - String value of the password.
        Returns:
        User object. Will return NULL if the email or password are not equal to the ones in the FogUser table.

      • insertUser

        public void insertUser(User customer,
                       java.lang.String password)
                throws UserAlreadyExistException
        Inserts a User object's data into Customer table in the MySQL database. Throws an UserAlreadyExistException if email is already in the database.
        Parameters:
        customer - User object to be inserted into the Customer table.
        password - String value for password to be inserted into the Customer table.
        Throws:
        UserAlreadyExistException - if the email is already in the Customer table in the MySQL database.
